noun.description: Chiefly Grammar. The action or fact of placing a word, etc., before or in front of another.
Medicine. Anterior displacement of the uterus or other part of the body; an instance of this. Also: the usual position of the uterus in which the fundus is bent forward with respect to the cervix.

origin: Early 18th century. From post-classical Latin anteposition-, antepositio action of placing before (1543 or earlier in a grammatical context; earlier in senses previous condition, priority in setting) from classical Latin anteposit-, past participial stem of antepōnere + -iō.
